title: Failure Modes: Noise, Fat Tails, Outliers

questions.question: Which practice most reduces model fragility to outliers?
options: Use fractional Kelly and confidence thresholds
questions.explanation: Sizing controls + thresholds buffer tail events and misclassification.

questions.question: A 5-sigma event under normal assumptions has probability ~2.87e-7 per draw. In 252 trading days, expected occurrences ≈ ?
questions.explanation: 252 * 2.87e-7 ≈ 7.2e-5 (but reality shows more tail events than Gaussian).

questions.question: What policy helps during whipsaw?
questions.answer_text: Wait for confidence to re-cross the threshold; avoid chasing flips with large size.
